direction.raw_text: mil Valium, stat. Mishra, worried, checks with Nurse Constance--they're losing the newborn:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Status.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think there's a pulse. I think. Frank looking at the EKG monitor--a green flatline--backs away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Frank walking away, not looking where he's going, backs into Noel's gurney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, sir, excuse me, I would please trouble you for one cup of water. The smallest thing in the world to ask for, water. A man is dying and that is me. Noel, his face battered from his encounter with Walls, pulls at his restraints, howls:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For days I've eaten nothing but sand, O Lord, I waited so long. Hazmat looks over:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ. Who the hell woke him up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. CANAL STREET--NIGHT 12 Young on the road again, sky turning blue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't give me that look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What look?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I'm talking about. It's all over your face. That I-just- saved-a-little-baby-boy look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We just saved a little baby boy. Think of it that way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to hear about it, okay? That's three jobs for the night. It's over. Three jobs and time for a drink. Six am, the cocktail hour. Pass the bottle; I know you're holding. Marcus reaches under the seat, pulls a pint of vodka, a quart of orange juice and two cups out of an old gym bag, passes them to Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bar is now open. Frank mixes a screwdriver for Marcus, straight vodka for himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, a little decorum if you will. What I was going to say is, is that holding that baby in my arms, I felt like I was twenty-one again. A call like that makes me think of going back to three nights a week, not two, start running again, cut down on the drinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll drink to that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's to the greatest job in the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Greatest job in the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twelve Young, I have priorities holding. Pick up the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do it, Marcus. Tell her the bus died, our radio's not working, our backs are out. Tell her we're too drunk to take any more calls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's do it! (keys mike) It's Marcus, Love, only for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Male diff breather, approximately 30, Houston and A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten-four. Marcus hits the sirens and lights, accelerates to full speed. The vodka spills; Frank grabs the dash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm coming, Love! I'm coming! Marcus swings the bus wildly to avoid a cab, SKIDS into a turn--and smack toward a parked truck. Frank covers his face and screams. CRASH! The back of the ambulance rams into the truck, the rear windows shatter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. Frank looks around, realizes no one is hurt. He climbs out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I quit! I'm through!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't leave me now. Frank walks up Avenue A, leaving Marcus and the disabled vehicle. The first rays of sun strike the buildings ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MERCY EMERGENCY--DAYBREAK Frank turning the corner, checking his watch, about to enter the Dark Bar across the corner from the hospital, watching Noel run past him and away, skipping from one foot to the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So long, Noel. The Emergency doors open: Mary Burke, head down, looking neither direction, walks away from Frank. Griss steps out after her. Frank joins him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on, Griss?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your friend there just untied the water beggar. Griss was coming out to thank her. Probably saved Griss a murder charge. (about Mary) Having a tough time of it. Mary starts to run. Frank follows. She pushes her way through a group of high schoolers; Frank does likewise, keeping his distance. Five blocks later, Mary hesitates at a plaza outside the Stuyvesant Town projects,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. STUYVESANT TOWN--MORNING Frank stops a few steps away from Mary; Mary turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. You seemed like you were in trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm all right. I just can't stand to see people tied up.  I'm in the waiting room for hours, listening to Noel screaming. The only reason he's screaming is 'cause he's tied up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't seem so bad to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say that. I wanted to cut my father loose too. They told me he almost died and five minutes later they say he's better and I go in. It's killing me seeing him fighting like that. (gazes up building) Look, since you're here, maybe you could do me a favor. I need you to wait for me outside this building, okay? I have to visit a friend who's sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Mary takes a few steps, turns back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only asking because it's a dangerous building. There's been some robberies, a woman was raped not long ago. This woman I'm seeing, she'll want to talk to me all day, but if I can point to you out the window and say you're waiting, I can be out quick. if anything happens, I'll be in apartment 16M.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I should come up with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I'm not back in fifteen minutes, hit the buzzer. That way she'll let me go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing's going to happen. I'll come with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'll be fine. I'm just visiting a sick friend. She walks into the building. He follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. ELEVATOR--DAY The dinged metal doors shudder shut as Frank follows Mary into the graffittied elevator. It jumps three feet upwards, stops, then continues, metal scraping concrete at each passing floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I shouldn't have asked you to come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You asked me not to come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise you won't go inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifteen minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just have to relax a little. Not feel so guilty all the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can still go back. I'll walk you home. You sleep a couple of hours, watch some TV, take a bath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be a cop. If you have any doubts about this, it's my fault. The elevator jerks to a stop; the doors open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. SIXTEENTH FLOOR--MORNING Mary turns to Frank:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You go on home, okay. I'm fine, really. I don't need you. Thanks. Mary pushes the bell at 16M. KANITA, 25, wearing a paisley robe, opens the doors and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Cy, guess who's here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary ... The elevator doors close on Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. LOBBY--MORNING Frank paces past the sleeping security guard, checks his watch. He presses the elevator button. CUT TO: INT. THE OASIS--MORNING The door to 16M opens:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Burke. She's a friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not here. Frank pushes past her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute. You can't go in. CY COATES, 45, light-skinned black, stands in the smoky room. Dark curtained windows block the sunlight; a dirty fish tank casts a green glow across the beat-up furniture. A large framed photo of a volcano hangs over the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay, Kanita. Come on in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks like a cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not a cop, he's a medic. (extends hand) I'm CY Coates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank Pierce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary said you might be coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sleeping in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She asked me to pick her up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, but she told me to tell you she wants to crash here a few hours. Terrible about her father, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I better just go in and see her. Kanita sits on the sofa next to an unshaven sleeping man. Coates gestures:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I call this the Oasis. Refuge from the world out there. Did you know two people were shot in this building last week? Frank heads down the hall toward the rear of the apartment; Coates follows. They pass an open door where inside TIGER, a fat man with dried blood running down the corner of his mouth, sits punching computer keys at a desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careful. That's the Tiger. The lady's down the hall. Welcome to Sunrise Enterprises, Frank, the stress-free factory. In the NEXT ROOM Mary lies on a mattress on the floor, yellow sheet pulled up to her neck. Frank leans over her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary. Mary, we've got to get going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wanted something to help her sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary, we really have to go. Mary blindly swings her fist at him, collapses unconscious back to the mattress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank, she's suffered enough. She's okay, I promise. (puts hand on Frank's shoulder) C'mon, Frank. Coates escorts Frank back to the LIVING ROOM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm always interested in people in stressful occupations and being a paramedic is about as stressful as I can imagine. Here, sit down. What's it like? Tell me some war stories.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a beer? Cy sits across from him, pulls out a pin-sized joint, lights it:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That shit is poison, Frank. We don't drink alcohol here. What you need is one of these.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you give Mary something called Red Death?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red Death? (passes joint to Kanita) Tell me something, Frank--does killing your clients make good business sense to you? The kids selling that shit have no sense. They'll be taken care of, don't worry about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should be going. I just quit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sleep is all stress reduction. Here. (offers white pill) You take one of these, sleep two hours, that's all you need. (Frank hesitates) Why do you think I'm telling you this, Frank--for my health?  You ought to look at yourself in the mirror, man. Kanita, get him a glass of water. Frank watches as Kanita gets up, walks to the kitchen. Coates places the pill in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this what you gave Mary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the stuff. I call it the Red Lion. Very king-of-the-jungle. No language, only brute power. You can't believe how relaxing it is. Kanita returns with a glass of water, gives it to Frank; Coates stands, feeds the fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank, I'm trying to help you.  Drink up. Frank swallows the white pill, drinks the water. He places his arms on the chair:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I'll be going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just take it easy. Frank looks around the smoke-filled room. Kanita walks over, extends her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take my pulse. (he does) It's good, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew it. I was wrong about you. You're not so bad. Kanita runs her hand across his shoulders. Frank starts to nod. The room getting warm and dark. His eyelids lower: sleep, precious sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FRANK'S ROSE DREAM Voices and sounds echo through the purple haze as Frank's mind drifts in time and space. Action and sounds slow, speed up, distort--intermix with the Oasis--as Frank goes back: This is how it begins: the last time, the first time ... Larry exits 13 Zebra as Rose, 18, wearing a yellow rain slicker, falls to her knees in the miasmic dream stank, onto the sidewalk, then onto her back. From forty feet away Frank, seeing her reach for a parking meter, grabbing the tube kit, running. Rose gasping for breath, Frank falling to his knees, lifting her tongue, prying her teeth apart, slipping the blade between her lips--Rose not breathing: waiting for her to inhale, shooting the tube down her vocal cords. Larry listening to lung sounds, belly sounds:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in the stomach!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name. Rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in the stomach, man. Frank pulling the tube out, trying again. Somewhere: CY Coates laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in the stomach! Let me try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One more time! Rose going blue, pulse rate dropping, EKG Slowing: Jim Morrison singing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stomach again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way! Larry ripping the tube from Frank's hands, taking over, pushing Frank aside, trying CPR, intubating Rose, air moving into her lungs--it doesn't matter. Rose is gone. Frank hears a SCREAM: it's his own voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. THE OASIS--DAY Frank standing screaming in the living room. CY walking over, Kanita standing, the sleeping man awaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank, take it easy. what happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He flipped out. Frank bends over in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be cool, man. You're having a paradoxical reaction. It can happen. (to Kanita) Didn't I tell you this guy was stressed out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stressed? He's psycho. Frank heads to where Mary sleeps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank, where you going? In the BACK BEDROOM, Frank picks up Mary, hoists her over his shoulder fireman-style and heads out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're making a mistake. Sit down and relax a minute. Frank opens the front door--no one stops him--exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll be back. And, by the way, you owe me ten bucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. STUYVESANT LOBBY--DAY The elevator doors open. Frank sets Mary on her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can walk. She says weaving out of the front doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. STUYVESANT TOWN--DAY Mary walks a Few steps into the plaza, stumbles; Frank catches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let go of me. (he relaxes) You shouldn't have come up. I told you not to. You could have gotten us both killed. Mary heads up the avenue: past baby strollers, postal workers, deliverymen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and CY have a nice talk? He tell you about Sunrise Enterprises, helping people? Well, I've seen him hurt people. Why are you following me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you can barely walk. Frank walking slightly beside and behind, lights a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember Noel, from the other night, how Noel is now? He wasn't always like that. He was my brother's best friend. Cy or Tiger or one of those other goons put a bullet in Noel's head. He was in a coma three months. Crazy ever since. They stop at a three-story brick apartment building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my place. She unlocks the door. He follows her in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MARY'S APT. BUILDING--DAY Mary grabs the railing, heads up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? You want to help me, you feel sorry for me? Keep it to yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to sit down a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or maybe you wanna fuck me? Everyone else has. Mary opens the door to her first floor apartment; Frank follows. The room is clean and feminine. Unframed water colors stacked against the wall atop a desk. A black lab greets Mary, she pets him. Frank slumps on the sofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been clean two years now. I got a job. I paint when I'm home. Don't bother anybody. Then all this shit happens. Frank keels over onto his side, his head hitting a cushion, eyes closed, dog licking his cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no you don't. You can't stay here. He's asleep, the sound of her crying fading in his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MARY'S APT.--NIGHT FADE IN: a passing siren wakes Frank. He thinks back, looking around the darkened room, realizes where he is. The dog comes over, licks his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, I'm Frank. Mary's friend. A very close friend who loves animals. He removes the blanket Mary has laid over him, stands:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Frank walks cautiously through the dark, finds a bathroom lit by a glowing Mickey Mouse switch. He flips on the switch: a string of green and red Christmas lights glow. Three types of soap sit on the sink. He turns on the faucet:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I washed my face with three kinds of soap, each smelling like a different season. It felt good to be in a woman's room again, especially a woman who wasn't comatose or severely disabled. I felt that perhaps I had turned a corner, like I saved someone, though I didn't know who.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. EMS GARAGE OFFICE--NIGHT Frank standing at Captain Barney's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're late, Pierce. I know, but I can't fire you. I've got nobody to work sixteen XRay with Walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got some forms here to fill out about that accident when you get the time. (hands him keys) I'll fire you tomorrow. I promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if there is no tomorrow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on, get outta here, Pierce, before I give you a big hug. (to Miss Williams) I love this guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MERCY EMERGENCY--NIGHT Frank walks toward Sixteen XRay as Walls gets out of the front seat. The EMS vehicle is dented and rusted, a relic of wars and a hodgepodge of parts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank, what do you know. It's you and me again tonight, the Rough Riders, tearing up the streets just like old times. (kicks the front tire) This old bus is a warrior, Frank, just like us. I have tried to kill him and he will not die. I have a great respect for that. Frank makes a "be right back" gesture, walks into ER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MERCY ER--NIGHT Saturday night at the Knife and Gun Club: the joint is hopping, the sound system blaring. Frank passing Griss holding back an angry Hispanic man with a bleeding arm:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't make me take off my sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, Griss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're full up tonight, Frank. Frank walks over to unit three, Mr. Burke's cubicle, pulls back the curtain. Burke lies sedated, wired and tubed. Frank leans over, feels Burke's pulse. Frank's expression changes--he looks at the EKG monitor: green lines seem to be at war, normal beats marching in formation against wild-looking rhythms, the heart working hard and not getting much done. Burke's face twitches. Burke's voice speaks in Frank's head:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to the bank, boy, take out everything you can. Frank turns up the EKG amplitude:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Burke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going. I've had enough. The alarms start to ring: EKG first, followed by the bells off the oxygen saturation monitor and low drone of ventilator. Intern Milagros pulling open the curtain behind Frank, shaking her head, reaching for the defribilator paddles, handing them to Frank. He steps back:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't reach. You're taller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought he was getting better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Technically, yeah. I suppose. It doesn't matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tha family wants us to do everything to save him--so, that's it. They want to keep him alive, they want to believe in miracles, we keep him alive. Shock him, Frank. He'll come back. He always comes back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clear! Frank shocks Burke: his body convulses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow! The heartbeats on monitor return to regular formation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You son of a bitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should I increase the lidocaine? Frank, despondent, not listening, walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. AVENUE A--NIGHT 16 XRay driving past a strip of night clubs and restaurants: the sidewalks full of young people laughing, jostling, embracing. Walls driving. In addition to the EMS two-way and AM radio, Walls keeps a police band walkie-talkie open. He looks into the back of the bus:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank, what you doing back there? Frank places an open drug box on the stretcher, pulls out an IV set, wraps a tourniquet around his left bicep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sick, Tom. I need a cure. (injects himself) Vitamin B cocktail, followed by an amp of glucose and a drop of adrenaline. Not as good as beer, but all I got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Frank. There's blood spilling in the streets. Frank crawls back in front carrying the IV bag, puts on the oxygen mask, turns on the main tanks, takes a deep hit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are hard times, Tom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Great, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great to be drunk. Sobriety's killing me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look up, Frank. Full moon. The blood's gonna run tonight. I can feel it. Our mission: to save lives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our mission is coffee, Tom. A shot of the bull, Puerto Rican espresso.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten-four. El Toro de Oro. Blast off. Walls hits the sirens, accelerates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cure's not working, Tom. Maybe we should go back to the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, kid. Tom'll take care of you. Put your head out the window, get some of that summer air. Listen to the music. El Toro de Oro. Andale. Pronto. Walls turns up the radio, drums his hands against the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, units, it's suicide hour. Fourteen Boy, I show you in the hospital sixty minutes but I know you're in the diner on 14th. Put down the burger, I got a call for you around the corner, 14 and 3rd, a man with a noose around his neck and nothing to hang it on. Sixteen XRay, don't even think about getting coffee, I have a call for you too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixteen XTerminator here. We like our coffee bloody. Make it good--my partner's dying to help someone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in luck, X: your patient awaits you with bleeding wrists on Avenue C and Fourth. Frank pulls the IV needle out of his arm, searches the glove compartment:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom, where are the Band-aids? This is an ambulance, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look out! 16 XRay lurches forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. AVENUE C AND 4TH--NIGHT 16 XRay brakes to a stop before a duster of derelicts, junkies and night people. Two DRUNKS are trying to help a friend with CUT WRISTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've gotta take him to the hospital. He tried to kill himself. Show him your wrist. Show A. Cut Wrists gets up, leans against the ambulance, shaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, he ain't right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold it. I will not take anyone anywhere against his will. This is America. People have rights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was bleeding before. He kept spilling his beer. I gave him mouth- to-mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're lucky you didn't kill him. (to Cut Wrists) We're going to hear it straight from the loony's mouth. Are you crazy? Did you try to bump yourself off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yesssss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you say so. Walls escorts Cut Wrists into the back of the bus, pulls a plastic electric patch off the EKG monitor. Frank joins them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, I am going to give you some medicine that is still very experimental. It's from NASA, and although the astronauts have been using it for years, we are the first service to try it. I will put this patch on your forehead like this, and in about a minute you will have to relax. (places patch) You will forget all your suicidal feelings. It's very important that you wear this for a least twenty- four hours and keep checking the mirror. If the patch turns green you have to see the doctor immediately. The side effects could be fatal. Cut Wrists nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the worst suicide attempt I've ever seen. You feel the pulse? Here. That's where you cut, and it's not across, it's down like so. (takes out his knife) Here take it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With all the poor people of this city who wanted only to live and were viciously murdered, you have the nerve to sit here waiting to die and not go through with it. You make me sick. Take it. Cut Wrists bolts out of the back of the bus, trips as he hits the ground, runs down the street, turning the corner still holding the patch to his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We cured him, Frank. When we work together there's nothing we can't fix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. EL TORO DE ORO--NIGHT 16 XRay parked outside a fluorescent chrome and plastic coffee shop. CUT TO: INT. EL TORO DE ORO--NIGHT Frank smoking at a formica table, his walkie-talkie upright next to an ashtray. Walls returns with two espressos as the Dispatcher rattles on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like they're trying to clean up the bus terminal tonight, Frank doesn't answer. Tom shines his mini-flashlight in Frank's eyes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, hello. Major Tom to Frank, time to come home. Frank watches a hooker on the sidewalk. Two street punks dripping gold and attitude head the opposite direction: one turns his head, looks at Frank--it's Rose. The Rose face. Frank getting up, grabbing his walkie and coffee, heading out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Tom. The city's burning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. HOUSTON--NIGHT Frank at the wheel, driving high speed: radio full volume.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatja doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel the need, the need for speed. I'm driving out of myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The brakes are shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've taken that into consideration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never felt better in my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixteen XRay, XRay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: X.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First of all, I want you to know how sorry I am about this. I've always liked you two. A unit above none, a legend in its own lunchtime, so it hurts me deeply to do this but I have no choice. You must go to Second and St. Marks. In front of a liquor store you'll find a forty year-old male, unconscious, lying next to his wheelchair. Do I have to say more?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've said too much already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's early for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all right, we're not meant to do Oh tonight. Something is going to happen. I can feel it. Tom hears something on the police band: a call for units to Stuyvesant Town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bingo. (keys police walkie)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to Central. What was that call?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A jumper. Stuyvesant Town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten-four.   One minute out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixteen, Sixteen XRay. Level One Emergency. But they're not listening--Frank's off to Stuyvesant Town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. STUYVESANT TOWN--NIGHT Police cars, fire engines, a massive Emergency Service rescue truck all flashing dome lights on the street, on the plaza surrounding Cy Coates' building: cops, Swat team, spotlights, onlookers. Frank and Tom, getting out, looking up: the spotlit figure of Cy Coates, thirteen floors above, suspended on a railing, legs dangling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whadda we bring?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better bring it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. LOBBY--NIGHT Frank and Tom, lugging their equipment, meet up with cops, firemen and their rescue equipment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator's fucked. We'd never all fit anyway. Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's thirteen flights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The news guys just pulled up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stairs, men, the stairs. The Sergeant leads a half dozen cops and firemen up the stairs as the elevator doors open. Tom, Frank and two COPS squeeze inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This guy a jumper?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got a call for shots fired on the sixteenth floor. The jumper called right after.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to sixteen. As the elevator doors close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. THE OASIS--NIGHT Frank steps out with the officers. The door to 16M is open: Kanita lies half in, half out the door, a perfectly round hole above her eye, splinters of bone and blood down the side of her nose. The carpet is soaked with water; shards of glass lie amid dying fish. A cop returns from the rear hall of the apartment, stands before photo of volcano:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it, nobody else home. Frank, looking over the balcony, sees Cy three floors below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to thirteen. Frank heads clown the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. THIRTEENTH FLOOR--NIGHT Frank emerges on thirteen: Walls, the panting Police Sergeant and team have overturned the furniture in 13M: the absent owners would have trouble recognizing it. The floor is covered with gas-powered metal cutters, acetylene torches, ropes, harnesses. A trail of blood leads to where Walls stands, Tiger's prone body behind him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get this, Frank--we got two patients. Number one, the scarecrow outside. Number two misses the railing but breaks both legs on the balcony, then throws himself through a glass window, heads to the bedroom, where he's now passed out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he's the steakhead of the night, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think the fire people can touch him out there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's he doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't had a chance to see him yet. I'm going to take care of sleeping beauty. Frank goes over to Coates as two cops strap on harnesses. CY hangs impaled on the railing, a steel spike passing through his hip. Glowing in spotlights from thirteen floors below, Frank takes Coates' vital signs, gently presses his abdomen:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does that hurt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Frank, IV bag in his teeth, putting an oxygen mask on Coates:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think you've hurt any major organs. (sets IV line) We got to get you off this thing without setting off bleeding. Cops behind click on harnesses ("You in?" "Yeah" "You in?") attach straps to pitons they've hammered into the brick wall, bring out metal cutters and torches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're gonna torch the fence. You're gonna feel the metal getting warm, maybe very warm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't hold up my head anymore. Frank passes the IV bag to one of the cops, holds Coates, head. CY relaxes his neck as SPARKS splay like fireworks beneath him, fall to the concrete.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, Frank, am I going to live?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been thinking about things. Meditating on my financial future. You guys gave me plenty of time to meditate on the future. Whatja do, stop for Chinese on the way over? There's plenty of food in my place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was tired. I needed a coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Kanita?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's too bad. Get some money, a nice looking girl on your arm, and everyone wants to take a piece. Some kid I wouldn't let wash my Mercedes is in my house, shooting at me. Damn, I thought I could make it onto the balcony like Tiger. He's fat, that's why, falls faster. I'm trying to watch my weight, and look what happens. Am I shot, Frank?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy can't shoot for shit, either. Goddamn that's hot. Frank looks: the spike in Coates' hip starting to glow red. CY stretches his hand toward the skyline, his face backlit by raining acetylene sparks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't it beautiful? When the fires start to fall, then the strongest rule it all. I love this city. The torch breaks the spike free: Frank and Coates FREE FALL three feet, jerk to a stop. Cy yelps. The crowd cheers from below. Frank now grabbing, holding Coates tightly--Frank's hands the only thing keeping Coates from falling--as the cops hoist them up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good thing we buckled you in, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about me? Who's supposed to buckle me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry, sir. The cops lift Frank and Coates onto the balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MERCY EMERGENCY--NIGHT 16 XRay parked in front. CUT TO: INT. MERCY CRITICAL CARE--NIGHT Frank walking out of the restroom wiping water off his face, looking at the gurney where Coates lies on his side, metal spike still sticking through his hip, IV line running to his arm, eyes closed. Nurses walk past Coates: he's stabilized, waiting his turn. CY, take a number. Frank spots Hazmat at Burke's cubicle, walks over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nurse Crupp, we're going to need some Valium here. He's waking up again. The ventilator alarm goes off as Burke pulls at his restraints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's that Valium? Nurse Crupp walks briskly over, injects needle into one of Burke's IV bags. Burke's voice speaks in Frank's head:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't. Don't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a hand, Frank. I've got to get something between those teeth. Frank helps Hazmat force in a bite stick. The monitor alarm cuts off, the ventilator starts up again, pumping air in, pulling air out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't believe how much he's improved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many times have you shocked him tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fourteen. We finally got him a room upstairs. Should be up there in a couple of hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you do, just have someone follow him around with a defribilator?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good, Frank. No, but they might surgically implant one, about the size of my thumb. It goes near the shoulder here, with two electrodes connected to the heart. It sends a shock whenever it senses a drop in blood flow. Amazing, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A medical miracle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MERCY WAITING ROOM--NIGHT Frank notices Mary Burke in waiting area with her brother, mother and several others. Gone is the lost daughter, the scared junkie. Tonight she's dressed for strength: leather jacket, blue jeans, black work boots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone, this is the medic who brought my father in. Frank, these are some of my father's friends. Frank greets them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We live out an the Island now, but we used to live right down the block from Pat. He was like a saint to us. Came as soon as we heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going out for a smoke. Mary whispers something to her mother, joins him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MERCY EMERGENCY--NIGHT Frank offers her a cigarette. Walls waits in 16 XRay, now parked at the curb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard CY Coates was brought in. He looked pretty bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll be all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too bad. He called me up today, can you believe that? I don't know how he got my number. He asks me do I want to come over and see him, I tell him I'd rather go to a leper colony. He says there's a new gang that wants to kill him, take over the business. I told him I hope he's right. That they kill him. That's what I told him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll be a while before he's up and running again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: last night I was weak. it won't happen again. And all that shit I said--it was just because I was stoned. Forget it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No problem. Thanks for letting me crash. It was the best sleep I've had in months. I used some of your soap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish these people would leave already. I can't listen to another story. Did you see him? (Frank doesn't answer) That doctor says the brain is coming around. They're waiting for the heart to stabilize. I don't know who to believe. He says they still have to keep him tied up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I bring you something back to eat--a falafal, some pizza?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we just ate. I only remember how tough my father was. Now I know he had to be like that, to make us tough. This city'll kill you if you aren't strong enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, the city doesn't discriminate. It gets everybody. Walls flashes 16 XRay's headlights, hits the horns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta go. Another call. Frank, his heart pounding, steps closer to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're all dying, Mary Burke. He leans as if to kiss her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not a good time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no time. He places his hand on her shoulder, kisses her lightly, walks toward Walls and the waiting ambulance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. FIRST AVE--NIGHT 16 XRay is cooking now--Walls at the wheel, Frank shotgun, passing a pint of whiskey back and forth: radio blasting-- INXS: "The Devil Inside."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get ready, Frank. Missed a drug shooting while you were dicking around in there. There's gonna be trauma tonight!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As long as we keep moving. No standing still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, look at your screen. Give up some blood!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixteen XRay, a man at the bus terminal shot three years ago says his arm hurts. Frank looks at a group of girls exiting an after-hours club: every one a Rose. Rose faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Tom, pick up a job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want some bum in the bus terminal? We'll wait for a real call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get in a fight, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who with?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's your job. Just keep driving, keep moving. No stopping. We're sharks. We stop too long, we die. Walls hits the accelerator: the old bus jerks forward:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's break something, Tom. Let's bust something, bomb something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want to break?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know--let's break some windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Destruction, distraction. I feel the need.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need a reason, Frank. You don't just go around breaking people's windows. That's anarchy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the reason? Give me a reason, Tom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me think. Tom hits the siren as he swings wildly around a stopped cab and its turban-headed driver:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Classic cabbie move. (to driver) Hey, swammy, that's called a crosswalk. You stop before it, not on it! Walls turns onto a cross street, spots Noel standing by a Mustang, baseball bat on his shoulder. He wears yesterday's blood-stained clothes, cut tires tied to his shoulders and elbows, chest and belly wrapped with steel wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know who to work over. Him. Walls slows as Noel lifts the bat, swings it into the Mustang's front window, shattering it, puts the bat down, using it like a cane as he walks to the next parked car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This guy's been terrorizing the neighborhood for weeks, ever since he got outta jail, wreaking general havoc, contributing to the bad name of the place. The term "menace to society" was made up for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's crazy. He can't help it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, why don't they put him away? Prisons don't want him. I took him to the hospital yesterday and here he is again. Noel reaches the next car, a Bronco, carefully hefts the bat, smashes it through the windshield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that. Tell me that's a crazy person. Every move is calculated. He knows exactly what he's doing. This is the guy. I've been after him for weeks. He's quick, runs like a rat, tough for one person, but with two of us--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, whatta I do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he sees me, he'll run, so I'll get out here. You start talking to him about baseball or something while I sneak around behind and get down and you push him. When he falls we get him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's ridiculous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, it always works. The simpler, the better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You learn that in the army?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flatbush. Walls slips out, crouches beside the bus. Frank, stepping out, walks over to Noel as he whacks the bat through the hatch of a Pinto.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a hell of a swing you got there, Noel. I'm thinking Strawberry in his prime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strawberry ain't shit. Drug pussy. (heads for the next car) Me.  I swing like Reggie. Mr. October. Number three, game six, World Series. Noel hauls back, lays into a Volvo: glass shatters. Noel holds the bat out, extends handle towards Frank:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, you try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'd better not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, sure, give go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Frank, intrigued by Noel's suggestion, has forgotten Walls' plan. He takes the bat as Tom sneaks behind Noel, crouching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell. (spits into hands) The next year, tiebreaker for the division, in Boston, Yanks down two to nothing, Bucky Dent steps to the plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh man, Bucky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pitch, high heater. Bucky knows what's coming. He steps in, smash, over the green monster. Frank cocks the baseball bat, relishing every moment, swings into the Volvo's side window. Shattered glass flies on his hands and clothes. Walls, fed up with this, stands:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank, what the hell are you doing? Noel, seeing Walls, grabs the bat, flees down an alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You go down those stairs there. Meet me back here if you can't find him in ten minutes. Call out if you see him. Get with the program, Frank. Walls takes off after Noel. Frank, taking out his flashlight, enters second alley, walks down dark stairs which hopefully circle around to Noel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. ALLEY--NIGHT Mini-flashlight leading the way, Frank steps gingerly down the refuse-strewn alley. Ahead: footsteps. He kicks something, thinking it's trash, looks down; a body rustles, pair of sleeping eyes look up. Suddenly everything seems silent. He passes a row of glowing red doors. Shadows flash in the distance. He hears a woman crying, shoots his flashlight her direction: nothing. Frank hears the voice again: Rose's voice :
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you kill me, Frank?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't mean to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should have helped me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to help. I wanted to. Shadows like hands extend against the wall ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you love me? Frank moves toward the reaching arms. The shadows swing like baseball bats. Noel SCREAMS. Suddenly, before him, a blurry mass of bloody dreadlocks-- Noel goes flying to the ground, Walls standing over him swinging the bat, hitting him, killing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got him, Frank! Frank stands back, watching Walls and Noel like some static black and white TV screen from his childhood. Noel, trying to protect himself, cries out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the moon, Alice! You little motherfucker! Frank charges forward into Walls, sending Tom, the baseball bat flying. Walls on the ground. Frank bends over Noel: Noel's face covered with blood, gasping for air, blowing red bubbles, convulsing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the kit! We're gonna tube him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna save you, Noel. You're gonna be all right. (to Walls) Do it, Tom! I'll call for fucking backup, I swear!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're crazy. Noel unconscious: Tom hurries down the alley toward the ambulance as Frank opens Noel's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to make it! You're going to make it! Pressing Noel's chest, Frank lowers his mouth, starts CPR. His mouth to Noel's. In the distance: Walls' footsteps returning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MERCY EMERGENCY--NIGHT 16 XRay parked out front: the sky is going blue. CUT TO: INT. MERCY ER--NIGHT Frank and Tom, their shirts blood-stained, pushing Noel down Skid Row, past Griss, past Nurse Constance. Tom wheels, Frank carries the IV bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take him straight through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who got that funky motherfucker this time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last show of the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ. Nurse Crupp! (to Frank) Anybody else hurt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crazy fucker. Walls pushes Noel into unit one. Frank looks over to unit three--Burke's cubicle is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Burke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Upstairs. 212. Had to shock him twice more. Frank nods, walks out. Behind, Walls helps Hazmat and Crupp place Noel on a bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. ROOM 212--NIGHT Frank Pierce walks down the hospital corridor, steps into room 212. Burke lies, tubed, wired and tied to life support. Blue light comes through the window. On the EKG monitor: a slow steady green endless line: up, down. Frank takes a moment, exhales. One by one, Frank flips off the machines. The clanging EKG ALARM is followed by the bass honking of the respirator alarm and two tweetering IV-drip alarms. Frank, holding Burke's pulse, watches the life go out of him. Hearing commotion outside, Frank flips the machines back on: the EKG monitor is flatline. A FLOOR NURSE rushes in, feels for Burke's pulse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened? (calling out) Code! Frank steps back as the Nurse hits the emergency switch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we doing CPR? Dr. Hazmat, out of breath, enters:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He coded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, what a way to start the day. He's in V-fib. Shock him. Frank pulls out the paddles, applies them to Burke's chest:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clear! Frank, knowing it's futile, shocks Burke: no result.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zap him again. Frank goes through the motions, pretending to shock Burke. The flatline doesn't waver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Get the cart, start compressions, get an epinephrine in. Frank backs out the door as a nurse and intern enter. In the corridor Frank listens as the activity becomes less urgent. Hazmat steps out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough. I called it. Let's get some coffee. (to Frank) You gonna tell the family? Frank nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MERCY EMERGENCY--DAYBREAK Frank walks out of Our Lady of Mercy, heads down the side street. He passes Tom Walls wielding a giant flashlight, smashing Sixteen XRay's headlights, denting the hood and side windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Die!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MARY'S APT. BUILDING--DAY Frank rings the buzzer. Mary, sleepy-voiced, answers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. FIRST FLOOR--DAY Mary, wearing a burgundy robe, opens the door. Frank says nothing. Her expression darkens. Frank looks at her again: it's not Mary, it's Rose. Mary has Rose's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead, Rose. Your father passed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can that be? He was getting better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He coded. They shocked him one too many times. I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was tough. You did all you could.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to keep the body going until the brain and heart recover enough to go on their own. Frank nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to come in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Rose/Mary opens the door wider, closes it behind Frank.
direction.name: direction
